meanings.definition: The practice of talking and thinking about oneself excessively.
meanings.sent1: Her constant egoisms made it hard for others to have a conversation with her.
meanings.sent2: Some people enjoy sharing their egoisms on social media.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his egoisms were so loud that they drowned out the music.
meanings.sent4: His egoisms built a wall between him and his friends, isolating him.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the overpowering scent of her egoisms.

meanings.definition: The belief that self-interest is the proper goal of all human actions.
meanings.sent1: His egoisms led him to always prioritize his own needs above others.
meanings.sent2: In some situations, egoisms can clash with the greater good.
meanings.sent3: The politician's egoisms were so strong that they influenced all his decisions.
meanings.sent4: Her egoisms were like a shield, protecting her from getting hurt.
meanings.sent5: The egoisms of the CEO drove the company to great success.

meanings.definition: An excessive concern for one's own welfare or advantage.
meanings.sent1: Her egoisms made her blind to the needs of those around her.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, egoisms can prevent people from forming meaningful relationships.
meanings.sent3: His egoisms were so extreme that he refused to share his dessert with anyone.
meanings.sent4: The egoisms of the character in the story led to their downfall.
meanings.sent5: The egoisms of the cat made it clear that it was the ruler of the house.
